date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019
content: I want to be able to say, "Alexa, ask GasBuddy what the prices of gas are in Swampscott, MA." Now, google has my work and home address and tells me what the traffic is on the route, if you could tell me what the gas prices are on approximately equivalent routes, that would be great. Barring that, a list that says, the Mobil on Paradise road is x, the Shell on Essex is y, the Gibbs by the beach is z, then I could  base my travel route on that. Now, I have a Show and a Dot, and I could put this on my Alexa, Good Morning routine. title: Does what it says it does > Not sure why the bad experiences
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
content: I have a 2020 Grand Cherokee. I say "Alexa, ask Jeep to start my car", it asks me for my pin code, which I provide, and it starts my car. Of course, there is a speed of light delay while the request goes up to the satellite and back down to my vehicle... maybe 30 seconds, but the car is started, the doors unlocked or locked, whatever. I'm not sure why there are  so any negative experiences. It was a simple install, app is easy to use, does what it says it does. Maybe because I started with a 2020 Vehicle and the most current version of the app?  I had installed the Jeep and UConnect apps on my phone and had them working before I installed this skill, so perhaps that played a role in function? The remote start is nice in the winter. I wish it would allow you to lower your windows in the summer.  It is very nice when laying in bed at night and you get that feeling... did I lock my car doors? Just say, "Alexa. ask Jeep to lock my car". Single prompt asking for your Pin, provide that information, say yes when it validates the vehicle you are trying to lock, and it gets locked. Don't have to get out of bed, rumble around for your keys, and goto the nearest window to use the remote. Just say the command and go to sleep. Same for when your wife asks you to unlock the car so she can get something out of i. Just say "Alexa, ask Jeep to unlock my car", provide the pin when prompted, tell it yes on the confirmation, and go on about your business.

title: Useful, But Check Updates
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022
content: After almost a year, the skill suddenly stopped working. I had linked it through my Jeep account on the Jeep website, but my login through the Jeep app kept kicking me out of the app, so I couldn't relink. I uninstalled the app, and when I went to the playstore, I saw that the Jeep app was now the Jeep Connect app. After installing it, I had to create my account all over, relink, and reauthorize. Now it's working fine again. It was a Jeep app change/update that caused the problems, not the Jeep skill. I have noticed in the past that I sometimes need to relink after Alexa updates, which seems to be about every 7-8 days sometimes. If the skill could somehow stay linked after every update to the app & Alexa, I'd give it 5 stars. As is, it worth the relinking issue, just for the things it does. I can start or lock up without going to grab my remote fob, check my gas & tires before I head out, and get alexa to find an address & send it to my Gladitor's GPS. All in all it's a pretty cool skill.

title: Misleading, you might need the uConnect skill instead
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
content: Jeep uses uConnect to work. I have a 2015 Grand Cherokee and it doesn‚Äôt work with this app, and I think it‚Äôs because this app requires SirusXm guardian (which my vehcile doesn‚Äôt support).If you have trouble with this skill, try enabling the Uconnect skill instead. This worked for me, I obviously needed to make sure that I had an active uConnect subscription first (if you can‚Äôt remote start from your phone app - don‚Äôt expect this skill to work lol).One star rating because now that i‚Äôve enabled this skill ONE TIME to try, saying ‚ÄúAlexa, start my jeep‚Äù prompts me to re-enable this incompatable skill every time. It‚Äôs annoying to have to say ‚ÄúAlexa, ASK UCONNECT TO start my jeep‚Äù - thats just more words. Also that‚Äôs annoying that i can‚Äôt use the JEEP skill to start my JEEP... like for real? üòì

title: Slow, but does work.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
content: Initially it didn't work at all but then I said "switch profiles" which got things working. Also make sure you are using the correct app for your model and year car. I initially denied the location permission but then enabled it - I don't know if this is required. This is only day 1, but I'm finding I'm extremely spoiled by Google homes and assistant. Some very simple commands like "ask Dodge to lock my car" were not recognized 3 times in a row. It sometimes takes a long time for commands to get to the car but that is probably mopar's issue since their own app takes a long time too. I don't trust this skill a whole lot yet but it's been okay. There is WAY too much back and forth with Alexa - it would be nice if you could just say your command and give your pin at the same time rather than having a huge long conversation. As it stands now it's a lot easier to just use the key fob, but this skill is a neat option. 2019 Charger.

title: It's about time!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
content: Works great for my 2018 Durango Citadel. Fully functional and does everything as advertised. I couldn‚Äôt be happier. I believe some of the confusion here is the skill actually installs 2 skills. One is for the older gen vehicles with UConnect and the other is for the newer gen vehicles with Sirius Guardian. Once I figured this out, I simply removed the other skill from the web interface. I specify this because the Alexa App on my iPhone still told me the other skill needed attention (linking with my Uconnect account) even after I removed it from the web interface. Either way, once you learn "How to talk to it ("Ask Dodge to start my truck")" it works flawlessly. I even sent directions with the app. Help is available at any time.

title: Works and Wordy
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
content: Like many on here, I find the process too wordy for convenience.  The commands are unnatural as well:  "Ask RAM to start my car?" is given as an example.  What car?  How would my RAM vehicle start my car?  How about just "Alexa, Start RAM"?I don't mind the confirmation but we all know trucks have a lot of emblems on them.  I can't wait all day for it to say, "Do you want to start your White 2019 RAM Laramie Long Horn Classic Long Bed Club Cab 8' Bed Diesel Power Wagon Pickup Truck you bought about a year ago with Sidesteps, Towing Package, Spare Tire, Bed Lights, and a bug on the windshield?"  OK, I'm kidding.  That's hyperbole.  But it does seem like you may have accidentally asked Alexa to read the War and Peace audio book.I think the other problem is after I say a command out loud, I have to say my pin out loud, too.  Hardly a 2FA solution, particularly if you're speaking into your cell phone in a public place, and if you're in your home you don't need that.  It would be nice if the command comes from Alexa at home it didn't need the extra step.Because of all this, I don't use it often, but unlike a few others on here, mine worked.

title: Same problem as everyone else: PIN.  (UPDATED)
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
content: I have a new 2021 RAM 1500. UConnect is all setup, SiriusXM Guardian is all setup, MOPAR account is all setup. Ive set my 4-digit PIN on Mopar.com. Ive still never been able to start my truck. Same problem as everyone else‚Ä¶i say my PIN nunber and i get, ‚ÄùSorry, I didnt find a match, please try again later.‚Äù GARBAGE!!!!  Is anyone out there listening?!?!?UPDATE: After several attempts to contact all parties involved (Alexa, UConnect, SiriusXM Guardian, etc). Something was finally reset on my account by someone and all services work. FINALLY!  They are somewhat faster than the UConnect commands too. I still think the skill is too wordy and wish it was more streamlined, but I hope they are working on that now. It would be nice to just be able to say, ‚ÄúAlexa, start my truck‚Äù or ‚ÄúAlexa, lock my truck‚Äù.  Still needs improvements, but at least it works for me now.

title: Terrible experience
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022
content: Bought the 2022 Ram 1500 Bighorn. The documentation and listed features say that this is offered with the truck with a free trial. That I can control my truck from in the house using the Alexa Echo. When it didn‚Äôt work I called support and got transferred from one department to another. Went out to the dealership and they called their support number and got the same experience of being transferred from one department to another. They gave me a case number to call when I got home.When I got home and called the support number they said that the case number was closed and that I would have to start over. This went on for almost 3 months with all the running around. Every time I would get someone that was very, very hard to understand with a thick accent of one kind or another and the communication was terrible. Finally today I get someone that is able to communicate well and after putting me on hold for a while to research the issue she comes back on and informs me that the Alexa feature hasn‚Äôt been implemented in the 2022 models of the Ram 1500s.I asked her, ‚ÄúWhat about my free trial? That was the main thing I wanted to test out to see if I even want to keep it.‚Äù Of course she tells me that the trial will be over by the time the Alexa feature is implemented and that I will have to pay for a subscription to test it out. 3 months of being jerked around just to find out that it hasn‚Äôt been implemented yet.All in all it was a very frustrating and unpleasant experience.

title: needs more usability testing

I would suggest making the request available at all times vs having to open the app before basic requests such as ‚Äúhow much fuel is in my truck‚Äù are available.The skill has potential but usability is low.

title: For those of you who lost access to remote functions
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
content: After hours of digging I found a fix. I went to Rams login page where I logged into my account. It then prompted me to finish my account set up on Mopar's site. On the Mopar's site dashboard I noticed my truck said "Non Owner". This is what was causing the problem. My address was not filled in. After updating my profile with the address associated with my registration my truck switched to "Owner" status and I could see my active guardian subscription. Then navigated back to the Ram login page where the information looked updated as well (except it says no vehicles on the ram page) and once logged in and linked I was able to get it working again. Also, not sure if it makes a difference my email address was the same with Ram, Mopar and Sirius.

title: How do I know my vehicle got the command?
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2018
content: I‚Äôve been asking Ford this question for over a year now. Now, more than ever, it seems more important. If you ask Alexa to lock or unlock your vehicle, how do you know it did it? They need to enable 2 way communication on the status page of FordPass to let you know the status of your door locks. How simple? Light up the button of the lock status, lock or unlocked. Simple. Why can‚Äôt they do this?

title: Two  Way Communication - Command Confirmation
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2018
content: I am super excited to see ths skill made available! Similar to what other reviewers have echoed, Alexa not only needs to tell me that a lock/unlock/start command has been sent to my vehicle, but also whether or not it was successfully completed.

title: Better and more than I expected
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2019
content: So...I always wanted a pick-up and landed on the F-150. Some may say for the wrong reasons, but any truck can do what I need a truck for, so the tech was the differentiation. I didn't realize this function even existed until the other day when my kid told me...I think you can use Alexa on your new truck Dad. Not sure how I didn't know about it, we have several Alexa devices and use them a lot. I find a lot of the Alex things to be somewhat less than perfect. Call it low expectations, but think about where we were ten, fifteen, twenty years ago...this stuff is AMAZING. I see people complaining about the PIN thing. I kinda get the argument, but if you don't trust the people around you, use your phone app. I'm guessing the logic behind the pin is to prevent intrusion. I think sitting around the couch saying anything (PIN, ask FordPass etc.) is way more convenient than reaching for your phone, key FOB or worse...going outside...so 1980's. All kidding aside, maybe not perfect, but good enough to get a 5 star rating out of me. I found it easy to setup and it has worked every time I've showed it off to friends and family. Keep it coming Ford and Amazon.

title: Persistence pays off!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
content: Update: I was finally able to link my Alexa app to FordPass. The only thing I did differently was manually type my username and password instead of the auto fill iPhone feature. Everything now works like a charm!** I have a 2018 F-150 Lariat 502A with Sync Connect.  However, I am unable to link my account.  I repeatedly receive the message that it "Looks like you don't have a vehicle associated with your account".  I have deleted my truck in FordPass and re-added it.  I have deleted both apps and started over.  I have tried to disable and re-enable this skill within the Alexa app to no avail.  At the recommendation of another user, I also tried to tap the Safari icon as soon as it appeared when attempting to link my account.  That did not work either.  I see Ford has commented on other people's posts with a generic "check the list of compatible vehicles" suggestion.  There's some other issue going on.  I know for a fact that my F-150 is compatible.

title: No issues whatsoever with both of my 2021 vehicles
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022
content: Compete functionality over both of my 2021 Limited Expedition and Platinum F-150. The trick (not really a trick) is to read the directions and follow them. It's a step process in which you talk to Alexa and ask it to "ask" Ford pass to..... then whatever you have pre-progamned or whatever is set to default. I live in a somewhat rural area in TN and it still works flawlessly.

title: Linked fine, but why the PIN?
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
content: Not a very secure way to control your car.First, the positive.  I did not have any issues linking the vehicle (2018 Explorer) with FordPass or setting up the skill.  Got the app working first, then added the Alexa skill, and bam it worked.I am however very disappointed that it requires a PIN every time you issue a command.  I mean really, whats the point.  Every time I use it, I would have to change the PIN.  My PIN as audibly heard by everyone around me whenever I use the skill and then saved in Amazons recordings which recently have not been very secure.  Requiring the PIN actually makes the system less secure.  So the only thing this feature does it annoy the user and make the skill more difficult to use.Skills should be simple: Alexa, ask FordPass to start my TruckRemove the need for the PIN, and I might use this skill.

title: Very pleased
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
content: Update: seems to have issues with giving all commands in one statement - not often than not, she didn't understand "open FordPass and start my car with pin 1234." Otherwise it is terrifically convenient.Original: I love that I can warm up my '17 Escape using the FordPass app while I'm still at the checkout counter at the grocery store, but now I can do it hands free from my bathroom as I put on the finishing touches when getting ready for work. It's the most useful skill I use right now (I don't have any smart home items yet). It's not failed even once so far.

title: A very useful app
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
content: Setting this up was a snap (When I figured it out). Even got Alexa to start my car with skills ("Alexa, ask FordPass to start my car" was a little long) The pin, though, could use a overhaul. Face recog, thumbprint, or voice recognition would be so much better than rattling of a pin every time. And it could be a security issue. The charging station part is iffy. Sometimes it works, other times not. It will say, "Now charging." That is fine. Asking Alexa to stop charging. That's the trick. She don't. And I learned the hard way not to ask her to stop charging. (It costs money to charge a Fusion EV, when the free charge is over). Open trunk command would be useful too. All the features this thing has, it misses there. Especially, when you need it. (Weather. Enough said). All in all it is a very useful app. I think those out there with issues, most might be an ID ten T issue. I had this error at first.

title: Amazon added this skill to my account without my consent, and broke my existing Lexus Skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2019
content: THANKS FORD! Now your "breaking down" cars you don't even make!! I own a Lexus, and have the Lexus Skill linked and enabled on my car and the Alexa app on my phone. Everything worked perfectly, until one day when Alexa replied I need to enable FordPass on my account, EVEN THOUGH THE VOICE COMMAND INVOKES THE WORD "LEXUS" IN THE COMMAND TO START MY CAR. My Alexa skill remote start of my car was broken for weeks, until I checked my Alexa skills on my Amazon account and found this gem I did not install or link.  Why Amazon thought this was a good idea to add to everyone's account because it is FREE is stupid. Ford should have contacted all their customers who have a car that supports this and informed them directly, as opposed to shotgunning this all over Amazon' Alexa. I am sure they have this info in their CRM records, as only new cars will support this.Ill see it this works once I remove the fordpass skill I don't need or want

title: So so skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
content: In my opinion the whole point of automation, like Alexa skills, is the convenience of it.  Making the minutiae simple and easy.  I actually expected  ‚ÄúAlexa, Start my truck‚Äù to work ‚Äúout of the box‚Äù.  Much to my surprise, it doesn‚Äôt.  Not only is my truck required to be called a car, but instead I must engage in a conversation with Alexa to start my truck.  Alexa, ask myChevrolet to start my car. Alexa replies okay, start you car, what is your pin? And I must give her a PIN number to start my truck.  All of that or I could click the button on my remote?  Can I put it into a routine, so that it starts my truck when I start my morning?  Nope. I feel like either I or whoever wrote this skill is totally missing the point.

title: Works great! A vocal, no hands/device dream!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
content: This works very well.  I have 1 Chevy 2018 vehicle linked to MyChevrolet App (You must have the OnStar Tech Package, which costs monthly after a free trial period, that allows app to work).  If you can't lock/unlock/start/stop your vehicle from out of range of your key fob (like from your office inside a building) this skill won't work.I have 2 Echo Dot's (3rd Gen), 5" Echo Show (newest gen as of 2020), 10" Echo Show (2020 2nd Gen w/ Zigbee hub).  This does what I ask, I have no problems with Alexa understanding. (FYI -  I have The 10inch Show with Zigbee hub, which was installed over a year after me just having the 2 Echo Dots.  So the Zigbee hub has nothing to do with this skill working correctly.)  While some reviews may say;It takes more time than the app) seem to also mention problems with Alexa understanding and having to repeat, I DO NOT HAVE THAT PROBLEM!  Alexa understands everything I ask (90-95% of time), for all the skills I have set.  Having my hands and phone/device free to do other things is very benificial.  For instance, while I am getting dressed for work in the morning, I can still ask Alexa to start my car, without me ever stopping getting dressed!  To me it is a time saver, but we all multi-task differently.  I also like getting changed from work to home clothes and ask Alexa to lock my car, when I forget!  To each their own though :)The MyChevrolet App with the OnStar Tech package combined with this skill is really great!  I do use the My Chevrolet App by itself, like at my office when I don't  have an Alexa device around, and other than tyimg up my hands and usually phone,  it works great!  This just gives you vocal command of your vehicle from your home and  the Alexa App (never tried vocal directly through App), just vocally on all my different Echo's. I highly recommend this skill if you have/use the MyChevrolet App and the OnStar Tech package!Great job Amazon!

title: App requires multiple interactions steps, no way to disable PIN or remember it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
content: I love the idea of using voice commands to start my car in the morning before I head out the door.  It's easier than fishing my keys or phone out of a pocket and doing the multi-button dance to enable pre-warm.  At least it should be.  Instead, I have to ask a very specific question to Alexa of "ask Chevrolet to start my car".  If I ask it to just "start my car," it's not sure how, and sometimes it confirms Chevrolet is enabled, and asks if I want to start it.  If it works, it then asks "whats your pin?"  Yes... That's something I want to shout across the house, so anyone inside (or possibly listening outside if a window is open) can hear.  Super secure that!  Why bother having a pin at all if you require people to yell it out every morning?If you allow Alexa to remember the pin, I may start using it again (and up the rating).  Otherwise, I'm going to delete it and bar access, since it's frankly unusable the way it is in most cases.

title: Needs additional functionality to be a real app alternative
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
content: The skill seems to be working well for the most part. My major problem is that, unless I'm missing something, there seems to be no confirmation of commands being successful or failing. Telling the app to start my car and having no way of knowing whether it actually did isn't very useful when you can't see the car. This is where it can't replace the MyChevrolet app, unfortunately OnStar commands fail sometimes, and without knowing the result you aren't going to try again. Ideally the skill would automatically report back the result, or add another voice command to check the previous command's response. It would also be great to add a few of the other app options like checking fuel range and tire pressures, but these are secondary.

title: Too annyong & difficult to bother using
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021
content: When I ask Alexa to have Car-Net start my VW, the skill instead responds with a ‚ÄúWelcome to Car-Ney‚Äù (mispronounced that way) greeting, and a usage introduction.  I then have to repeat my request, and only then does it work.I blame this on the VW developers, because their app is also annoyingly difficult to use & feature-free.  T start my car with the app, I have to login *3 times in a row* ‚Äî once for the app, once for my only registered vehicle, and once again, with my PIN, to start it. So, this skill is actually slightly easier to use than the app.

title: great idea
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
content: This is a great idea, theoretically. But, like many, if not most, Alexa apps, the execution leaves a lot to be desired. There are no real settings to speak of. Hitting the launch button doesn't make sense. If I'm going that deep into the time consuming, cumbersome, and extremely buggy aleax app, I could have just used the car-net app instead.I recall setting a pin. I know exactly what the pin is. But, Alexa tells me that it's wrong. Now, I can't recall how to go in and change the pin because the Alexa app isn't intuitive. I'll have to play with it or stumble across it. Why don't app developers have real end-users in mind? This should be straightforward. Hit setting and all the settings you need SHOULD be available.

title: 2019 avalon touring. U have to have a remote connect car with a activated trial or subscription.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
content: Works great. It says on toyotas site that linking alexa with remote connect for remote start..because that's what this alexa skill is for...It says you have to have a Toyota owners account first of all and your car registered, and then you have to have a remote connect trial (activated trial) or a active subscription. Then you search Toyota alexa skill in Amazon site search box and search and then click the Toyota first thing on the top of page. Then at the top right of that page you'll see enable skill and click that and it will redirect you to the toyota owners page to sign in to your Toyota account with the email you signed up on Toyota with. Then it will ask you to set a pin for alexa. That's it, done and connected. Worked right away for me. You just gotta follow directions on toyotas website. But to activate any of toyotas car features you have to have a registered Toyota account and then download the Toyota app. The app is called Toyota (that's it) just Toyota, and make sure u download that. U can create your Toyota account through the app also. Make sure you input your vin when you make account for your car if your just now registering it. Then you have to say alexa ask Toyota to start my car...etc. The page tells you how to say a prompt.

title: Issues with pronunciation of car model
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2021
content: I have a 2019 Toyota Corolla Hatchback XSE.  When I ask "Alex, ask Toyota to start the car", the skill asks for my pin, I say it, then it says "Thanks, I am reaching out the your corolla hatchback X-S-E-5-D-R-H-A-T-C-H-B-A-C-K to turn it on."  Like every time, it spells out that entire last part.  It's quite annoying.  Can't this be fixed?It really should just say "Thanks, I am reaching out the your corolla hatchback to turn it on" and that would be more than enough and not grate on my nerves so much.  Just recently within the last 6 months it started pronouncing Corolla correctly (it wasn't for the longest time), so I am guessing the developers caught wind of it and fixed it.  I am thinking someone can fix this from the backend as well.

title: is this best toyota can do? rely on an alexa skill???
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020
content: first, not a fan of using skills:  "alexa, ask {maker} to {do something}". in fact, i refuse to buy any "smart" device that relies on using a skill instead of a well thought out seamless integration. so, toyota - i'm unimpressed.PROS: during the 1st year of owing my car, i can remote start it, lock doors (if i'm close enuf), unlock doors, check gas, check mileage.CONS:the toyota connect feature is only free during the 1st year. after that, there's a fee - no thanks.  after 12 months, this alexa skill is useless.takes a good while for the car to respond.if i want to remote start, i have to say a PIN - takes too long, especially compared to friends who have a remote start button on their key fob.when i tell alexa to ask toyota if my car is locked she responds "all of the doors on your highlander dash v6 xle awd are locked."  i cant get her to just say "all of the doors on your highlander are locked".this is a simple, unimpressive skill with little to no practical purpose - and it loses all usability after 12 months.

title: BUYER BEWARE! DOES NOT SUPPORT REMOTE START!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
content: I purchased this product over another, less expensive competitor solely because it supported Amazon Alexa. The fact of the matter is, this product doesn't allow remote starting via Alexa, which is the entire reason I installed the REMOTE START system in the first place. Sure, it's nice to be able to lock and unlock your doors without hunting for the keys, but in cold New Hampshire winters, I want to be able to wake up, tell Alexa to start the truck, and go about my day. This is highly deceiving - your marketing materials should emphasize the fact that remote start isn't supported via Alexa. Perhaps this review will save another consumer from spending their hard-earned money on something that doesn't do what's implied.

title: Follow this to get it working!

Finally changed the nane to simply ‚ÄúCar‚Äù and i said ‚ÄúAlexa, ask drone mobile to start CAR‚Äù alexa will ask for your pin, you tell her the pin, wait 5 seconds and done!

title: Alexa integration, you say?! NAH. Drone just thought it sounded good.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020
content: So part of the reason why i opted for a remote start with Drone App is because I rely on Alexa frequently for many things throughout my day. I imagined this beautiful world where I could be shaving and simply tell Alexa to start my car on a cold Ohio morning. So the most important reason for me to use the Drone App was for the Alexa interface. The reality? Complete flop. Every time Ive asked to have any command accomplished from Drone, Alexa tells me that she doesnt know basically what the hell Im saying because there is no such car. she then LISTS my car whose name is strangely my Drone App profile name. When i ask her to, lets say, unlock (Profile Name) thinking that must be the trick, Alexa responds with the same information about not recognizing the car but i can choose from this list blah blah blah.  How hard is it to send a simple command to my very expensive remote starter with paid Drone App subscription? Apparently much more difficult then telling Alexa, while driving, to turn on my $10 smart bulb in my living room. what gives? this needs addressed hopefully before the time comes to renew my subscription. I'll just use the remote control if the Alexa feature is a bust and dust the Drone App. Sorry but not a good first impression of cutting edge consumer electronics. ugh!

title: dont buy this product
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
content: I purchased a drone mobile unit for my truck with a 2yr app subscription. I had a friend added to my account, who also had a Drone Mobile product, so this friend could also unlock my truck on his phone app. A few months into the subscription I was told the current unit in my truck was now out of date and I would need to purchase and install a new unit for a "discounted price" of $29.99. After several conversations with Drone mobile representatives, once being hung up on, and approximately 30 minutes for each call before I could speak with a representative, a manager finally agreed to send me a free updated unit to have installed in my truck. After the new unit was installed it would not work. When I again called Drone Mobile I was told my account had been deleted and my friend was the only authorized user for MY ACCOUNT that I activated and paid for with MY credit card. After this mess was fixed I learned that my 2yrs subscription was cancelled. I had to argue and show proof that I purchased a 2 yrs subscription. I was so aggravated I canceled my subscription and requested a refund that I am still waiting for 1 month later.

title: Make sure you purchase the necessary options
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021
content: I think some folks that left bad reviews were not fully aware of this device + skill functionality. If you can remote start your car with your phone on the Drone App, you can set it up with Alexa. First / set a PIN on your account on the Drone Mobile site. Not in the app. Second / give your car a clear and simple name. Good: The van, my car, red truck. Bad: old Bessie, Jonah‚Äôs Jalopy, Melvin‚Äôs Benz. Ok, now this is a Skill. Alexa cannot start your car. She has to ask Drone Mobile to do it. So the phrase is ‚ÄúAlexa, ask Drone Mobile to start The Van‚Äù and she asks for your PIN, then you reply and say it slowly ‚Äúone ‚Ä¶ five‚Ä¶ three ‚Ä¶ two‚Äù.  Good luck.

title: Remote start DOES work with Alexa!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2021
content: Log into your account on DroneMobile website. Does NOT work on app (to my knowledge). From Dashboard, click on your vehicle (click on picture or vehicle name). Under vehicle ID, you'll see vehicle name.  Change vehicle name to 'car' or 'truck'. From Dashboard again, click on 'Edit profile'. On the right, below the timezone, set a PIN. Then you could ask Alexa 'Alexa...ask Drone Mobile to start truck (or 'car'). She will ask for the PIN. Give her the PIN and the vehicle will start. This really works...verified today 2-13-2021.

title: Great product!! (BUT READ THIS BEFORE BUYING)
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
content: I did no purchase from here but this review is for informational purposes. This product is a great ADD ON. That is what the drone is. It IS NOT an auto start. It is an add on for Compustar auto starts. It will not start you car unless u have a compustar auto start. All it is is an interface between itself and the auto start itself. You have to put in the auto start too. If not then all it will do is lock and unlock the doors. I bought mine and had it installed locally. For a final cost of $499. That was the auto start, drone and installation. I paid fee for three years for $130. It works great! Yes telling Alexa or Siri to start is is not and option yet, but locking and unlocking door works ok at best. That should not be a deal breaker. The only reason I bought it is because factory starters suck! And don‚Äôt have a very long range, so being able to start from unlimited range is well worth the fee to use it. Also you can add key fobs to is for 100 because an antenna must be installed. I chose not to have it done yet but probably will at some point. Finally I don‚Äôt think the price is out of line for being able to start your car from basically anywhere. One last time the drone is not an auto start it is a add on to the auto start. It‚Äôs all there on the website. Or do what I did and go the a retailer and ask some questions. Besides I would be a little skeptical if the whole thing was only 100 bucks.

title: Amaxing! (And so much fun!)
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022
content: I never thought I‚Äôd be able to start my car from the shower while getting ready for work, but here we are! It‚Äôs a life-saver on frigid Wisconsin winter days (and prob hot summer dsys, too. We‚Äôll see)! Drone Mobile‚Äôs features are great, and compatibility with Alexa is flawless aand so simple. I can start/stop, lock/unlock, view battery voltage, adjust temp, set timers, etc.(many aux settings) at home with all my Alexa devices, or from my phone ANYWHERE using the Alexa app (or Siri ü§≠üòÜ but Alexa‚Äôs easier) wherever there‚Äôs WIFI or cell service‚Äîeven with my Apple Watch!! I absolutely love it! It‚Äôs paired w/ Compustar remote start.*(These is my experiences with the system I purchased, and optional services I pay for. It may vary with other dystems/option packages! Talk to your sales person/installer.)

title: Great
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
content: It works within 5 minutes of setup. I start my car thru my echo dot with my voice. Set it up initially thru the app and website and then log into your account thru a desktop view internet page. Go to your setup and change the name of the vehicle to something you want and enter a pin to allow Alexa to start your car. Then you simple say to Alexa ‚Äúask DroneMobile to start ‚Äúwhatever name you chose‚Äù. Then Alexa will ask for the pin you created on the drone account setup. And poof its done. You have to put in an extra minute of work and then it‚Äôs seamless. It‚Äôs not configured out of the box. Obviously enable the drone mobile skill as well thru the Alexa app and it‚Äôll link your account. I love this thing.

title: 2020 Review by a tech guy!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
content: So I‚Äôve done a ton of research this is by far the best Choice for a smart phone remote start system. To save the most amount of money go with the five year premium plan it is roughly $370 but if you do the math it by far saves you money with a lot of features. Remember you have to do this within the first 30 days. Viper just doesn‚Äôt have the features of drone Mobile. One of the number one things I was looking for is Alexa start capabilities. Step one access your DroneMobile account on a computer and in dashboard set up a pin you can make it super simple as little as three digits. Then enable the skill and login on your Alexa app. Name your vehicle on the drone app ‚Äúcar‚Äù ‚Äútruck‚Äù ,‚ÄùVan‚Äù...etc . Then simply tell Alexa ‚Äúask Drone mobile to start my ‚Äúblank‚Äù. Unrelated to Alexa but you can also use Siri to only lock and unlock your doors. simply say hey Siri lock my car, Siri will then ask you to confirm, you must say ‚Äúyes‚Äù

title: Pathetic Support Staff and Software App App
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021
content: When I first bought my Truck this App worked great, then about a 6 months ago, not so good.  In fact sad.  Features disappeared for no apparent reason, and the support staff is and was clueless.  It took them about 3 months to fix.  Like and Idiot, I renewed , and bought a different plan.  Once that old plan expire, and the new plan kicked in, some of the features were not there that come with the plan.  Again, the support staff was clueless, and it seems like they read from scripted answers because they all say the same thing.  we have to kick it to the tech support staff, and they get back with in 3 - 5 days.  Yeah, right.  Even their email are scripted.  I wouldn't recommend this stuff to anyone, and I was stupid enough to give them a second chance.  I'll be asking for a refund.  Do buy this stuff it's a borderline scam.

title: It DOES work!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
content: For those of you getting a CLI-101 error code. I went to my phone and deleted the GMC app, reinstalled, (there are TWO sites api-gmc, and myGMC) and re-logged into both. Then went to the truck and restarted Alexa. this time she said to "wait while we reinstall your app". and then walked me through logging into amazon (on my phone) and putting in my device code to link the truck. For those of you saying it doesn't work, it DOES. Be patient and figure it out and you will enjoy her!

content: Sorry, but I'm not about to pay GMC (or any car company) a plan fee just so I can tell my 2015 pickup to start or whatever. I've already paid $57,000+ for the vehicle - this should be free! (Not to mention car companies are the only providers that charge a fee to update their outdated navigation systems - even during the warranty period).My 2002 Sierra has Onstar but it no longer works because GM changed the system and to get it to work, they want me to fork out $300.00 for a new rear view mirror that doesn't provide the temp or compass info my current mirror does - what a deal!

title: Works perfectly, but not as quickly as I'd like.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2018
content: Works perfectly, as you'd expect. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that you are asked for your PIN before Alexa will send commands to the car. This is an important security feature but it slows down the experience to the point where I'd rather just find my key fob and start the car. But if you live in a condo or somewhere out of range of the key fob this app would be great. Still not faster than the iOS app which confirms your identity with the fingerprint ID which is faster than entering your PIN.

title: Alexa Start my car
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2018
content: I am not sure of all the variants you can use for the spoken dialogs but I followed the instructions and linked the skill to my Buick app.  I only tried three commands using the form Alexa, ask Buick to start my Enclave.  lock my doors, unlock my doors, etc.  Each one asked for my PIN (I would not be comfortable not having PIN protection) and it took no longer than the time it took for the dialog exchange.  Each command worked flawlessly.  I do not envision a need to use this all the time but I was impressed and would use it under extreme weather conditions to pre-heat or pre-cool the vehicle.

title: Works great!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
content: I got tired of the "Ask Buick..." nonsense and created my own routines for this skill.  Now all I have to say is "Alexa, start the car" and it invokes the "Alexa, ask Buick to start my Enclave" command in the background of the Alexa skill.  You can create any routine you want to control this skill.  Works awesome!!

title: Intermittent Functionality & No Confirmation
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
content: I love the idea of this but it seems finicky - only working 80% of the time or so.On top of that, there isn't a confirmation that the command has been successful.I'll ask it to start my car, it'll ask for my PIN, I provide it, it says its starting the car then i just have to hope it actually did.When i use the Android app I get a push notification letting me know the command was successful. This app would be SO much more useful if Alexa confirmed when the vehicle has actually started! Add this feature PLEASE!

title: Very useful addition to the MyBuick app
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
content: At least for me, it allows me to give the command verbally from the house or my office without worrying about where the phone is or in the case of the office whether I'm in range of the remote.  Accuracy in starting the car has been 100%, but I recognize that other folks have had a different experience.  It's not like it costs anything, so give it a go!

title: takes 3+ times to get it tight
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019
content: EVER TIME I say "echo, tell Buick to start my car" I get some response about something called Vivant. it tagged atleast 3 tries of the SAME EXACT PHRASE before it works.also when it DOES turn on my car it doesn't activate the seat or stearingwheel heater (these work when I use my phone off or key for remote start.

title: Having Problems Linking myBuick skill?
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
content: I have been in the same boat as many of you with the myBuick skill.  I have had no problems getting things set up except for the myBuick skill.  Everytime I would sign in using my username and password I would get a message that said input error.  This was very frustrating because I have had no problems logging into the my buick app or onstar.  So, I contacted Alexa technical support several times with them all telling me to disable and enable the skill.  This did not work so I stopped trying.  Then a few days later, a light bulb went off and I decided to contact Onstar.  I am so glad I did because they fixed my problem in less than a minute.  My issue was my email was spelled incorrectly through onstar.  So, if you are getting the input error message, it is probably because your email might be wrong through onstar.  Give them a call, you will be glad you did!!  Skill works great!!!

title: Works better than the Enform Remote App
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2018
content: This is a pretty slick skill. Only thing to note is you have to get the verbiage correct for it to work seamlessly. Saying ‚ÄúAlexa ask Lexus to...‚Äù does the trick.I actually find that starting the car with Alexa is much quicker than using the app itself (which speaks volumes about how terrible the Lexus app is). I noticed several reviews about not getting a confirmation of start. Here‚Äôs a trick for getting them. Enable confirmed start notifications in the Lexus app. Then when Alexa successfully starts your vehicle, you‚Äôll get a notification on your phone confirming the start.

title: PROBLEM SOLVED  . *Read this*
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2019
content: I have a 2015 Lexus ES 350 and I had the same problem connecting my skill to my car as others have mentioned and I found the solution.  During the setup the skill told me that my car was not set up in Lexus Drivers when it indeed was.  All I had to do one evening was call Lexus Enform Support at 336-231-6700 using options 1 ‚Äì 2 ‚Äì 1 and I found the help I needed. The support technician said that my Enform account had been corrupted and he reset it . I received an email with a link to reset my password and that solved the whole problem. Then voil√†, I started using the skill successfully !  It is way cool!  Best skill ever! After that successful endeavor I went on to activate a skill for my 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee and then another for my 2017 Cadillac STS . Everything works perfectly!Woo Hoo!!

title: So convenient
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2018
content: I have the Lexus Enform app on my phone and watch and use them daily, but this is so much easier! Instead of having to go through an app, login, start my car, confirm my identity, and then the app will start my car. But with this, all I have to do is say Alexa start my car and tell her my PIN and my car is started- so only two steps!The only issues I've had is sometimes Alexa will forget that the skill is enabled and will ask me to enable the skill and there's another skill called Plexa so she'll mishear me and think that's what I want.

title: Create Real Settings
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
content: Just came home with my brand new 2021 Black GV80 and enabled this skill after establishing my Connected Services.  The skill linked just fine, and I can't say the same for other link-type skills, so 1 star. I like the intent of this app, so another star.  The skill behaved as instructed, so the 3rd star but thats where it ends.  The Skill needs real Settings desperately.  Alexa frustrates me beyond belief, she won't respond unless I refer to my car/SUV as the ‚Äúblack Genesis GV80‚Äù.  I am the only driver in my household and should be able to name the vehicle what I want, then refer to it accordingly.  Further, the Genesis app requires a PIN to perform certain actions, great security. But in my secure home, if the vehicle is connected to the same wifi signal as Alexa, I should NOT be forced to provide my PIN to perform an action.  Argh, get real Settings, not just Link your app.

title: OK.  Maybe I'm being generous with 4 stars.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
content: Brand new 2020 G80.  Got this app the next night.  It does OK.  About 30% of the time, it says: "You'll need to relink your Genesis account".  But then 10 seconds later, it's fine again.  Also about 30% of the time, it doesn't do what I ask, but I get a message from Genesis itself in my email, so I suspect that's not a problem with this skill, but rather, with the upstream Genesis service that connects to the modem.I'm not sure how this Alexa skill "solves" any "problem" I have--I used it once to make sure car was locked, but I could have just as easily walked to the window and pressed the bottom, or used the Android app.

title: Alexa works with G90 but states having trouble finding skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016
content: Alexa does start and stop my G90 on command even though she states having troubling finding that skill.  The indicator for success is when she ask for my pin before then saying she's having trouble. Initially, once setup was complete she never asked for my pin before stating having trouble and therefore not successful. After a half hour or so she began asking for my pin followed by a statement of having trouble yet she starts the car. I suppose it took a short delay to update and link to the Genesis system to begin asking for my pin.  I'm not sure why she states having trouble although the car starts successfully.  Successful start is confirmed by a text notification from the Genesis app as usual.

title: Awful experience!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
content: I have a brand new beautiful Lincoln nautilus (2021).  I was an hour away from home for a doctors appointment and had a flat tire.  I thought,‚Äùok, I‚Äôm going to learn about my Lincoln way‚Äù.  I opened the app only to see a portion of the home page,  couldn‚Äôt get it to full view,  couldn‚Äôt use it.  It was frozen.  ( My other apps were just fine).  I called the local Ford/Lincoln dealer who told me to call the person I bought my car from.  I did,  And she said she would get me the number, meanwhile she sent me a screen shot of the Lincoln way app showing me where the ‚Äú24/7‚Äù was located.  I guess she missed the part that I could only see a quarter of my page and it was frozen!  I called the Lincoln way number,  And the gentleman spoke very broken English,  and there was an awful echo of everything I said reverberating back to me.  It took a while for me to slowly get vin number, location,‚Ä¶.to him.  He wanted the address,  And I told him over and over I was in a grocery store parking lot and gave the street and cross street and what was across the street,  but I didn‚Äôt have an address.  After a while,  he said I was set,  and would dispatch someone to change my tire.  I received a text a few minutes later from Lincoln with a gps type map to confirm my location.  I did.  A few minutes later I received a text saying someone was dispatched and eta was 45-60 min.  ( I took this time to figure out car-play).  An hour later I received a text asking if I was taken care of‚Ä¶I responded ‚Äúno‚Äù.  I received a text saying they would follow up.  I received a text saying new eta was 30 min.  45 min later I received a text with the name of who they had dispatched and asked if I had been taken care of.  I said ‚Äúno‚Äù.  I called the tire/tow company myself and asked how long it would be,  and I was told the request had been cancelled by Lincoln way.  At this point,  I was hot, tired, unhappy and frustrated.  After new ETA‚Äôs several times,  I called AAA , (which my Lincoln dealer had told me I should cancel, because I now have wonderful Lincoln way 24/7 service. ).FYI‚Ä¶AAA was there in 15 min.  Only to find THERE IS NO SPARE TIRE!  so,  we had to dispatch a tow, To shorten this,  Over a period of 6 hours,  yes, 6 hours,  I had 17 texts from Lincoln way.  I talked to them on the phone 3 times.  I talked with the tire/tow people 3 times.  No one ever showed up!  Right, I said ‚Äúno one ever showed up‚Äù!AAA ( who gave an ETA of 30 min and showed up in 15, found I had no tire, and then dispatched a tow for me. The tow ETA was 45 min, and they were there in 35,  towed me to a dealer,  who put on a new tire.WILL BE MAKING SURE EVERYONE KNOWS ABOUT THIS AWFUL SERVICE.

title: Inconsistent Results

content: Have only been using for a week with my 17 MKZ and starting the car from inside my house with an echo has worked consistently. With an actual Echo device this message typically means it has lost WiFi connection, so I've endured my phone does have 4G signal but still no luck. Am hopeful an update will solve.Also it'd be nice if Lincoln+Alexa in the car could pull music from Spotify like an Echo does in my house as the default music service. Not sure if this is simply a feature that could be added, or if it's a licensing thing.

title: VERY BAD EXPERIENCE
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021
content: Purchased a Brand new 2020 Lincoln Aviator, had for about 4 months. Tried to remote start last night and it wouldn't work. So I tried to manually start it and still wouldn't work. The door wouldn't shut, the lights wouldn't come on or the car. Not to mention it was freezing outside.Called "Lincoln My Way" and the representative was nice but completely inexperienced. Gave me the incorrect directions and, of course, nothing worked. So he transferred me and I another rep to arrange towing my car.Well, he was even worst. He kept asking me the same questions about 20 different ways. So if I tell you the car won't start then why are you asking me to turn the car on and put it in neutral. He just made matters worst. Finally got my tow setup and that was the end of that, so I thought.So I had it towed to the local Oxmoor Lincoln. First, the website said the service department was  open on Sunday. Secondly, I called to get a loaner, per my warranty and the worthless extended warranty, and the Sales Manager tells me I have to wait till Monday because the Service Dept is closed. Mind you I have to work, with no damn car to drive in!!!I was beyond frustrated. First, that a brand expensive new car is a piece of junk!!! Then the representatives was not even a 2 star rating and the local dealership is a joke. I had a Chevy and my sales guy always made sure I had a loaner car. We didn't have to go through service and they brought it to you or picked you up. I pay all this money for NOTHING!!!! I will never buy another Lincoln EVER!!!

title: Honda Accord 2020 Touring 2.0T
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
content: This works super well for my car and i love it. For set up instructions,1. Make sure your HondaLink app is setup and you have the service subscription to use it.2. Make sure you can perform app operation successfully on HondaLink app.3. Open up your Alexa app4. Go to the menu at the buttom right that says (More)5. Select the Skills and Game option.6. Select the search lens option at the top right7. Type HondaLink and select the option8. Select enable skills9. Sign in using your HondaLink Email and Password10. Select your car and scroll all the way down to authorize app sync11. Hit done at the top left12. You can run discovery on alexa app but it not neccessary13. Now you have completed your set upHope this helped.

Pfft, if you have a smartphone, you're already there - as long as it's a BENEVOLENT overlord, we'll be ok. title: Just start the car.
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021
content: Like many here, i wish Alexa would just instantly ask for my passcode or use voice detection to immediately start the vehicle. While its still kinda useful if your hands are full, it is honestly no faster than the app. There are many skills here (like simplysafe) where the commands and dialogue included just take up SOOO much time. Ive managed to figure out how to cut down on the command phrase by using routines and the custom option to just be able to say ‚Äústart car‚Äù but this doesnt help with Alexa‚Äôs response being so long.i remember when all these smart devices started to get popular and i always thought people looked And sounded so silly talking yo robots. i still feel this way. i didnt buy this device so that i can talk to robots for fun. i bought it so that i can use it as a quick and efficient vocal button to trigger things around the house. Not sure if these flaws could ever be changed with an update but if they can, that would be amazing.

title: Empowers my teen to drive safely
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
content: Very easy to install, and the app is super intuitive and colorful.I bought this for my 18 year old son. He's had it for a couple of days and both he and I like it a lot. At first, he was very upset that I would propose putting a device in his truck. But I followed the advice on Bouncie's website for how to talk to my teen, and it worked. Basically, they recommend being transparent about the product, and emphasizing 'yes, I trust you that's why I helped you get a car, and I also want to keep you safe.' He installed it himself and took his truck for a drive.  When he returned, we looked at the map together, and discussed speed at various points on his outing. He actually likes the app. The app lets him decide when he wants to get alerts, such as when speed exceeds 70 or after hard braking. He likes the idea of getting feedback from the app on his driving.The big win is this: our discussions about his driving are now data-driven.  He used to interpret my comments as nagging; now I can point to the app and let the data do the talking. So the device is turning out to be a way of empowering him to take responsibility for safe driving. I'm happily surprised by that!

title: I normally do not write reviews but I highly recommend this product
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2018
content: I normally do not write reviews but I highly recommend this product. Very easy to use and very inexpensive. I did a lot of research on this stumbled onto this product. The only problem was that the feature That tells you your gas levels did not work with my car. Turns out it is car specific. I contacted the company with the question and they responded in less than an hour on a Sunday. Great customer service. I use this for my teen drivers since the peer pressure from friends to joy ride is great. Now they have an excuse not to bend to the peer pressure.

title: In Which Vehicle?
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2018
content: Seems like a nice idea to be able to check up on your vehicle and thus child, but if you are monitoring multiple vehicles, the skill is very lacking.  When you give a command, expect to hear "In which vehicle?", but then, Alexa stops listening.  Give her a vehicle name in the request, but she will usually ignore it and ask "In which vehicle?" anyway.I did get it to work once, though.  So, maybe there's hope.  I look forward to seeing some improvement.  It could be really handy.

title: GARMIN SPEAK PLUS ISSUE HAS BEEN RESOLVED
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
content: I WAS ON THEIR EMAIL LIST TO BE INFORMED WHEN THE COMPATIBILITY ISSUE WOULD BE FIXED. I RECEIVED AN EMAIL AND I WAS ABLE TO COMPLETE THE SETUP PROCESS. MY GARMIN SPEAK PLUS WITH ALEXA IS NOW FULLY SETUP AND FULLY FUNCTIONAL AGAIN.Just to be clear about this issue. The problem isn't with the Garmin Speak Plus or your phone. The issue is a compatibility one between the Alexa Garmin skill and the Garmin Speak Plus. I spoke with Garmin and they confirmed. They told me they are working to fix the compatibility issue with the Alexa Garmin skill as they are the developer of the skill.  It's just a waiting game. They informed me that this issue has been escalated. The only thing I can do now is wait for the fix and an email from them. I told them that they have rendered all Garmin Speak Plus with Alexa useless and that they are still available for purchase. This is so wrong.

title: The basics are there, and I'm looking forward to seeing how it matures
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2018
content: The Garmin Speak is an awesome idea.  I love having Alexa in my car to be able to control my Smart Home!  However, the audio doesn't work for me.  If I connect it to Bluetooth, I have to set my car stereo source to Bluetooth and I can't listen to the radio or the satellite radio.  I've decided to just use the Speak's speaker; however at times, to be able to listen to it at reasonable levels, my phone requires me to accept a warning that listening at high volumes for long periods of time can damage my hearing.I have also had issues with the phone connecting to the Speak.  I have had to restart my phone, let it connect to Bluetooth, log into the phone, open the Speak app, and let it connect multiple times.  However, other times, it immediately connects automatically.I also own the Garmin DriveLuxe 50 GPS.  I miss the large screen with the Speak.  Right now, I have both the Speak and the DriveLuxe 50 installed in my car.  The GPS functionality of the DriveLuxe far exceeds the Speak, but it is convenient to be able to say, "Alexa, ask Garmin to navigate to Best Buy" and "Alexa, what are the business hours for x?  I think I'll end up keeping both devices for different reasons.  The DriveLuxe is awesome as a GPS.  The Speak is awesome as Alexa and a backup GPS.  (I love being able to tell Alexa to "Set the thermostat to 74" on my way home from work!)I foresee many improvements, tweaks, and new skills to be added on a quick pace with this device.  I'm looking forward to watching the technology mature, but I hope the device that I have bought won't be obsolete too quickly as the resource demands increase.Ideally, I think that Garmin should integrate Alexa into their full GPS devices.  Alexa on my DriveLuxe would be perfect!

title: Awesome (sometimes)

For example, it takes me to the house BEHIND my house (on a perpendicular street) whenever I navigate home.  The positive is, Garmin is receptive to fixing mapping errors, so I let them know.On the other hand, I love what it PROMISES to do... that is, hands-free navigation.  When it works, it's awesome.  And I love being able to chat up Alexa on the road, so we can continue our argument where we left off at home.

title: Garmin Speak with Amazon Alexa works pretty well. The sound will be as good as ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2017
content: Garmin Speak with Amazon Alexa works pretty well.  The sound will be as good as the speakers you have in the car. Is able to do navigating and play music at the same time which is great. Sometimes you have to raise your voice above the level of the music to get Alexa's attention. I put it up and to the right of the rearview mirror and it makes for a clean installation without wire clutter.  Directions are clear and work fine.  If you already know how to pair devices, etc. then it is a breeze.  If you are tech challenged then get someone to do a neat installation and pair your device.  Has a hard time learning "home", but that may just be how I am addressing Alexa.  You have to say, Alexa ask Garmin to...  Overall pleased with the purchase.

title: Mercedes Me Connect app - remote start limitations
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
content: The remote start app only works about 50% of the time, the other 50% it gives an error message "An error occurred when sending the request to the vehicle. Please try again later".The remote start won't work if you have less than 30% fuel, which is between 150-170 kms.The remote start will only work twice before you have to physically start the vehicle. This would primarily be an issue for people who live where the winters are very very cold.Having a reliable remote starter was the main reason I chose Mercedes over other models. If I had known the remote starter was unreliable and had these limitations, I would have selected another brand.

title: Works great, even though it says it doesn't.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
content: This skill works great. I can start my car while I'm getting ready for work without having to take out my phone to use the app and I can lock my car if I forget to. For the people having issues with the "trouble accessing Mercedes Me" response, it is most likely because you have a 2018 or older car that is supposed to use the original Mercedes Me, as this skill is optimized for 2019 and newer (and some 2018 C and GLE-Class) which gives you all the additional functionality shown in the description, like how much gas you have left or your range. If you have a car that uses the older MM app, it still works. It will still always respond "trouble accessing MB" but the command still goes through and my car starts every time. Hope this helps some people having issues with this app.

title: Select Region prompt for Amazon Alexa - Solved
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
content: If you are receiving the "Select Region" message from Alexa it is because the "Interface to Third-Party Providers" service is not enabled from the Mercedes Me Connect portal.  Login to the Me Connect portal (not to be confused with the Mercedes Me portal as there are 2).  Select My Vehicles. Choose Manage Services (Lower right).  Enable "Interface to Third-Party Providers".  I spent hours researching this and no one at Mercedes was able to tell me this is the fix.  My Mercedes reps said the Me Connect was not compatible with Alexa.  I knew there was no way the engineers in the Fatherland would allow that to happen.  I was able to determine this by seeing in the car using the Console (Picture 1): Mercedes Me --> My Services --> Digital Assistants was not enabled.

I took my cars couple of times and I explained to them how I cannot connect my phone to the car ( not with Bluetooth and not with wire car's speakers will not connect to any app like Facebook videos even your gallery video's but sometimes is working with Youtube and sometimes not ) and they told me go to Apple Store and Which I did . Apple store then told me that this is a Mercedes problem and I believe them, because I had a 2013 E Class Mercedes and I never had any issues with that needless to say when they give you a loaner car all those cars work perfectly even though they are the less expensive models such as C class or GLA but they connect to my phone perfectly and I explain it to them and the Encino , Calabasa and W.I.Simonson branches told me they are not able to do anything about it because the car has an older system(my car is 2017) I told them that I never had any problems with the system of my old E class which was a 2013 Mercedes but they still refused it also Calabasas dealer bring one 2018 S class and they tried but it had the same issue as my car . The first month of my lease I got 2 flat tires and when I get to tire shop ( because I didn‚Äôt buy the tire protection plan ) The person showed me the tire and from the inside they were ripped and there was a big tear from inside the tire but outside had no damage or scratch . title: Once you set up everything it works
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2017
content: I have read a lot of reviews on here saying that this skill doesn't work. However in order for this to work you need to make sure that you set up a couple things first.First I recommend visiting the BMW connected website to make sure that your vehicle is compatible with BMW connected apps.After doing this navigate to your device specific application store and download the BMW connected app for North America.Following the downloaded the app open it up and you log in and connected to your vehicle.**NOTE:  if you things that I've noticed as I own a couple BMWs the BMW connected feature needs to be activated if you just purchased your car it usually takes 24 to 48 hours. If you're running into issues using the BMW connected app features you can always hit the SOS button in the car or call the bmw customer service they are super helpful. I also recommend going online to the BMW connected website to ensure that your profile is set up correctly. While at the website check to see if your BMW is capable of using BMW connected features. Beginning around January of 2017, for 2013 BMW models and earlier, BMW disconnected the BMWConnected feature as these have a 3G/2G SIM card these cars use the CIC and CCC iDrive interfaces.Once you've downloaded the app, logged in, and connected to your vehicle. Pay attention to the features available for your model.Now link the  the alexa skill by using the in skill prompts .Following this use the correct commands to activate the skill. And you should be good to go.Overall the skill it's been really good has help me lock my car when I forgot to lock it. As always the skills are always getting better so give it a try.

content: The fact that you can't select from multiple vehicles makes this essentially useless for owners of more than one connected vehicle. title: A great thought, slow to execute, misses a lot of commands
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2016
content: I think many reviewers have made the mistake of complaining about Blue Link and/or the pricing offered by Hyundai when rating this skill.  This is a review of the actual Alexa skill, separate from what Hyundai may or may not charge.First, this is a great start.  Hyundai is one of the only car companies offering this kind of flexibility so I have to give them credit for being at the cutting edge of blending virtual assistants for the home with cars.  This skill comes in handy from time to time and it definitely gives you that "wow I'm in the future" feeling when you simply ask your virtual assistant to start your car while you're still pulling your pants on.  I also have to say that many other companies can learn from this skill, as it's one of the only ones I've used that allows me to issue two commands at once (ie "Start my Sonata and set the heat to 72 degrees), or just one command (ie "Start my Sonata").In practice, though, I've found that more often than not it's easier to just unlock my phone and start the car with the Blue Link app.  The problem here is that issuing the "Ask blue link to start my sonata..." command virtually never works.  It's not just me, everyone in the house has struggled with it.  The only consistent way I can get it to work is to ask Alexa to open Blue Link, listen to the lengthy "welcome to blue link" schpeal and then say "Start my Sonata..."  And if that command fails, I still have to listen to yet another lengthy blurb about incorrect commands before trying again.  It would actually be quicker to run outside and just start the car.Speaking of speed, this is sloooooooooowwwww.  I can issue the command to start the car, walk casually downstairs, put my shoes and coat on, wait for the garage door to open and walk out to the driveway before the car starts.  That's not an exaggeration, that's my daily routine.  A major part of this is that Blue Link itself is maddeningly slow, but relaying it through Alexa adds more time to the already slow process.Overall, the skill itself is a great step in the right direction, but it needs to do better at recognizing commands, and Hyundai needs to speed up the process.

title: kinda bad

Also, having to yell my pin out across my house makes it pointless; I mean, it‚Äôs like if you needed to tell the cashier at the store your credit pin verbally, it‚Äôd make it useless. Overall that freaking pin is pointless anyway., so please get rid of it!

title: The App is nice, the execution is crap
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2019
content: BlueLink looks great on the surface and provides a lot of convenient options.  The app is well designed and easy to learn.  Unfortunately, BlueLink itself is just this side of garbage.  The only way to remote start your Hyundai is through the app.  It would be fine if the car started with 10 or 15 seconds of sending the command but real world times are closer to 2 to 3 minutes.  So if you want to send any command to your car (lock, unlock, start, etc.) then you'd better plan ahead.  This is not an exaggeration.  I have had commands to start the vehicle take longer than 4 minutes before my 2019 Santa Fe actually starts.  That of course depends on whether the command actually works.  I would guess that sending a smart command through the app is successful 60-70% of the time so expect that you should get an error message 2-3 minutes later saying the command did not succeed about a third of the time.  How about this setup?  You cannot remote start the vehicle unless the doors are locked.  I like the idea from a security standpoint, but why doesn't the app just build in the lock command as part of the remote start process?Here is a real world scenario of what really can happen about a 3rd of the time:10:45am: Send command for remote start10:48am: Receive a message on your phone that it failed to start because the doors are unlocked10:49am: Send command to lock the doors10:51am: Receive confirmation that doors are now locked10:52am: Send command to remote start10:54am: Receive message that remote start failed (no reason given)10:55am: Resend command to remote start vehicle10:58am: Vehicle finally startsThis is NOT an exaggeration. This is the kind of timetable that happens about 1/4 of the time.  13 minutes just to get the car to start.  Now add 10 minutes for it to warm up.  It took 23 minutes and 4 commands just to get the vehicle ready to go.  Plan accordingly, heaven forbid you don't have half an hour to plan to start your car.The non-vehice command related stuff is decent.  It takes a good minute or so to get status updates and reports but that is almost acceptable (hence the 2 stars instead of 1) and there is a lot of stuff you can do with it.  I suspect BlueLink has some network problems outside of the app itself.  If you're a migrator from something like OnStar you will be very frustrated with the delays.

title: Remote Stop Bug
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
content: If I use the mobile app and remote start the car, then change my mind, I can just choose to stop it through the app. However, if I use the Alexa skill to start the car, I am unable to stop it either through the Alexa Skill OR through the app. I get an error message every time. The error message in the app states: "Remote Stop for your vehicle cannot be processed. Remote Stop can only be used during Remote Start session. [HT_539]." If I try to stop it through the skill, Alexa tells me: "Hmm. A remote stop request cannot be processed since your previous remote start process has already concluded." This happens no matter how long the car is on for. I have to either go turn the car off manually, or wait for the it to timeout and turn itself off.

title: Trash
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021
content: Had Bluelink for the trial period when I first bought my Sonata, it was OK. it worked for most of the time, although there was a couple times the remote start from the app failed, or the diagnostics took a couple days to update, not a biggie.Once summer hit, my trial ended and I really didn't need to remote start my car anymore.Earlier this week, I decided to reactivate it. I purchased Connected Care+Remote. I updated my App all should be good right?It says it could be up to 24 hours before my account is updated, no worries. They charged my card. 4 days later, when I try to Lock/Unlock or remote start my car, I get a pop up saying I need the more expensive Connected Care + Remote + Guidance.I combed through the website looking for this "small print"... (Which can't be found by the way)The subscription page breaks down what each one will get you. Guidance just included navigation, which I don't need and am not going to pay and additional $10 a month for.On the website, on my account and subscription page it literally states to Lock/Unlock and remote start, you only need the "Remote" (+Connected Care, because that is kind of an automatic).But the app says I need the top package that includes the navigation? No thanks.When I try to see my diagnostics from the App (Connected Care) the same pop up appears telling me I need Connected Care + Remote + Guidance... yet your car health is the point of the Connected Care... ?So I say fine, I will log on from my computer, it shows my subscription, renewal date, last payment, subscription level, etc. But when I try to do any of the remote features, it says "Error". When I try to do the Connected care features, it updates from before when I had the free trial.They have a "Virtual Assistant" which is trash. Forget about getting a live human being on the phone, I've tried for two days. You go through their automated system which states if you want to talk to a rep stay on the line. But that never happens. Either the line goes dead or you get automatically rerouted to "Genesis Protection Plan" and asks if you are a "CPO or Dealer" ( I pressed both on different calls since I wasn't going anywhere) Still nothing. I got to one part that tells me to enter a claim #.It is literally IMPOSSIBLE to talk to a human being.I am getting a after market remote start on my car, Merry Christmas to me.I would not recommend BlueLink to anyone. Even if it works great, once you have an issue, there is no avenue to get it corrected.

title: Yet to have it work
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
content: Update: Still having issues with commands not going theough, but my biggest complaint is with the lock command requiring a pin code. With my ford, I have a routine every night send a lock command. It happens automatically. With Hyundai Blue Link you have to say a code for it to go through. Why? I can understand if you are starting the car or unlocking the car, but why when locking?****************************************************************Had fun getting the actual car registered with Blue Link. From the dealer not putting the car under the right email, to the modem not activating.Now we have it working from the app, although there is about a 30 second to 1 minute delay.However, now that I have it connected with Alexa, I have watched as the Show app crashes when asking it to unlock the doors, and a dot continually circling until, I assume, the Blue Link app crashes. Using the Alexa app on the phone for a Blue Link request causes it to lock up on the request page. So basically it is worthless of an Alexa Skill.Reading other reviews, I am sure I would not be a fan of saying the PIN code out loud. They should really make the API show up as a device or scene. That way it is native to Alexa and if shows up as lock you can give it a personal PIN.
